snippet: Dov Lipman is both an ultra-Orthodox rabbi and a newly elected member of Parliament who is hoping to help bridge the divisions between the secular and ultra-Orthodox in Israel.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Dov Lipman, ultra-Orthodox rabbi and newly elected member of Israel's Parliament who is hoping to help bridge divisions between secular and ultra-Orthodox in Israel.

byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz and Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Dov Lipman is both an ultra-Orthodox rabbi and a newly elected member of Parliament who is hoping to help bridge the divisions between the secular and ultra-Orthodox in Israel.

headline.seo: Rabbi Dov Lipman Seeks to Bridge Israeli Divisions
headline.main: Bringing Ultra-Orthodox Traditions to Israel’s Parliament, Olive Branch in Hand
headline.print_headline: Bringing Ultra-Orthodox Traditions to Israel’s Parliament, Olive Branch in Hand
